segments.en: Linked Discourses 22
10. Flowers
100. A Leash (2nd)
At Sāvatthī.
“Mendicants, transmigration has no known beginning.

segments.pli: Pubbā koṭi na paññāyati avijjānīvaraṇānaṃ sattānaṃ taṇhāsaṃyojanānaṃ sandhāvataṃ saṃsarataṃ.
segments.en: No first point is found of sentient beings roaming and transmigrating, hindered by ignorance and fettered by craving.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, sā gaddulabaddho daḷhe khīle vā thambhe vā upanibaddho. So gacchati cepi tameva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upagacchati; tiṭṭhati cepi tameva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upatiṭṭhati; nisīdati cepi tameva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upanisīdati; nipajjati cepi tameva khīlaṃ vā thambhaṃ vā upanipajjati.
segments.en: Suppose a dog on a leash was tethered to a strong post or pillar. Whether walking, standing, sitting, or lying down, it stays right beside that post or pillar.

segments.pli: Evameva kho, bhikkhave, assutavā puthujjano rūpaṃ ‘etaṃ mama, esohamasmi, eso me attā’ti samanupassati.
segments.en: In the same way, an uneducated ordinary person regards form like this: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self.’
They regard feeling …
perception …
choices …

segments.pli: viññāṇaṃ ‘etaṃ mama, esohamasmi, eso me attā’ti samanupassati.
segments.en: consciousness like this: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self.’

segments.pli: So gacchati cepi ime pañcupādānakkhandhe upagacchati;
segments.en: When walking, they walk right beside the five grasping aggregates.
When standing …
sitting …
lying down, they lie down right beside the five grasping aggregates.

segments.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, abhikkhaṇaṃ sakaṃ cittaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ:
segments.en: So you should regularly check your own mind:
‘For a long time this mind has been corrupted by greed, hate, and delusion.’
Sentient beings are corrupted because the mind is corrupted.
Sentient beings are purified because the mind is purified.

segments.pli: Diṭṭhaṃ vo, bhikkhave, caraṇaṃ nāma cittan”ti?
segments.en: Mendicants, have you seen the picture called ‘Conduct’?”
“Yes, sir.”

segments.pli: “Tampi kho, bhikkhave, caraṇaṃ nāma cittaṃ citteneva cittitaṃ. Tenapi kho, bhikkhave, caraṇena cittena cittaññeva cittataraṃ.
segments.en: “That picture was elaborated by the mind, but the mind is even more elaborate than that.

segments.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, abhikkhaṇaṃ sakaṃ cittaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ:
segments.en: So you should regularly check your own mind:
‘For a long time this mind has been corrupted by greed, hate, and delusion.’
Sentient beings are corrupted because the mind is corrupted.
Sentient beings are purified because the mind is purified.

segments.pli: Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekanikāyampi samanupassāmi evaṃ cittaṃ yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, tiracchānagatā pāṇā.
segments.en: I don’t see see any other order of beings as elaborate as the animal realm.

segments.pli: tepi kho, bhikkhave, tiracchānagatā pāṇā citteneva cittitā, tehipi kho, bhikkhave, tiracchānagatehi pāṇehi cittaññeva cittataraṃ.
segments.en: The creatures in the animal realm were elaborated by the mind, but the mind is even more elaborate than that.

segments.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, abhikkhaṇaṃ sakaṃ cittaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ:
segments.en: So you should regularly check your own mind:
‘For a long time this mind has been corrupted by greed, hate, and delusion.’
Sentient beings are corrupted because the mind is corrupted.
Sentient beings are purified because the mind is purified.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, rajako vā cittakārako vā rajanāya vā lākhāya vā haliddiyā vā nīliyā vā mañjiṭṭhāya vā suparimaṭṭhe phalake vā bhittiyā vā dussapaṭṭe vā itthirūpaṃ vā purisarūpaṃ vā abhinimmineyya sabbaṅgapaccaṅgiṃ;
segments.en: Suppose an artist or painter had some dye, red lac, turmeric, indigo, or rose madder. And on a polished plank or a wall or a canvas they’d create the image of a woman or a man, complete in all its various parts.

segments.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, assutavā puthujjano rūpaññeva abhinibbattento abhinibbatteti, vedanaññeva … pe … saññaññeva … saṅkhāreyeva … viññāṇaññeva abhinibbattento abhinibbatteti.
segments.en: In the same way, when an uneducated ordinary person creates a future life, all they create is form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness.
What do you think, mendicants?
Is form permanent or impermanent?”
“Impermanent, sir.”
“Is feeling …
perception …
choices …
consciousness permanent or impermanent?” …
“So you should truly see …
Seeing this …
They understand: ‘… there is no return to any state of existence.’”

suttaplex.blurb: A dog leashed to a post will always remain close to that post. In the same way, beings remain close to aggregates in this endless cycle of transmigration. The Buddha refers to a well-known painting called “Conduct”, and says the mind is even more diverse than that; and indeed, the animal realm is the most diverse of them all, and it is produced by the mind.
